etymology.description: 虎(虎) (hǔ, "tiger") + phonetic 号(號) -> 虎(虎) representing the roar -> 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") or 言(言) (yán, "speech") added to signify crying or calling -> 号(號) represents marks or signs
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a tiger's roar, with 虎(虎) as the key component. The addition of 口(口) or 言(言) emphasized sound, later leading to meanings related to communication, such as an exhaled sound or a sign.
etymology.simplification: 号(號) simplified the original 虎(虎) and 口(口) elements by keeping the phonetic 号(號) with the line 丂(丂).

parts.english: line representing roar or exhaled air

examples.chinese: 请写下你的学号(請寫下你的學號)。
examples.pinyin: qǐng xiě xià nǐ de xué hào.
examples.english: Please write down your student number.

examples.chinese: 门牌号代表住址(門牌號代表住址)，彰显家的温暖(彰顯家的溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: mén pái hào dài biǎo zhù zhǐ, zhāng xiǎn jiā de wēn nuǎn.
examples.english: The house number represents the address, reflecting the warmth of home.

examples.chinese: 他在包裹上写了货物的编号(他在包裹上寫了貨物的編號)。
examples.pinyin: tā zài bāo guǒ shàng xiě le huò wù de biān hào.
examples.english: He wrote the product's serial number on the package.
